intro: Ruellia tubiflora f. flava, commonly known as the yellow-flowered ruellia, is a flowering plant native to Central America and the Caribbean. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The species is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
